intro: Mabea parvifolia, commonly known as the small-flowered mabea, is a species of flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its small, pale yellow flowers and hairy, oval-shaped leaves. It typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forests and shrublands. Mabea parvifolia is often found in regions with high humidity and well-drained soil.
